      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop()
        The main game loop. This loop is running during all game play as is responsible for the following activities: - Updates current scene - Handles input for current scene - Renders current scene Updates 60 times per second, renders 60 times per second, handles input at 60 times per second The loop goes around every 16.666 milliseconds, or 16,666,667 nanoseconds

      • changeScene

        public void changeScene(java.lang.Class scene,
               java.util.ArrayList args)
        Changes the currently active scene. An active scene receives update(), render() and handleInput() calls. This method will always return immediately. The scene change will be queued up until the current scene is finished with its current tick.
        Parameters:
        scene - The scene to switch to

      • loadScene

        public void loadScene(Scene scene)
        Loads a scene into memory. A scene must be loaded before it can become active
        Parameters:
        scene - The scene to load

      • unloadScene

        public void unloadScene(java.lang.Class scene)
        Unloads a scene from memory. If we are unloading the running scene, this method will still return immediately but the unload will wait until the current scene is done with its tick.
        Parameters:
        scene - Scene to unload

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.Class scene)
        Checks to see if a scene is loaded
        Parameters:
        scene - Scene to check
        Returns:
        True if the scene is loaded, false otherwise.

      • getCurrentScene

        public Scene getCurrentScene()
        Returns the currently active scene. The returned Scene isn't thread safe. You must implement thread safety within the scene itself.
        Returns:
        The scene that is currently running

      • getScene

        public Scene getScene(java.lang.Class scene)
        Returns a reference to a particular scene. This method is used to get access to scenes that are loaded, but are not the active scene. The returned Scene isn't thread safe. You must implement thread safety within the scene itself.
        Parameters:
        scene - Scene to get a reference to.
        Returns:

      • addRunnable

        public void addRunnable(java.lang.String key,
               java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Adds a runnable which can be managed and accessed from Game. This method will create a new Thread and start running the runnable when it is called
        Parameters:

      • removeRunnable

        public void removeRunnable(java.lang.String key)
        Removes runnable from Games management. WARNING: this method will not stop the thread your runnable is in. Be sure to stop the thread before calling this method to avoid a memory leak.
        Parameters:
        key - Reference key for the runnable to stop
